statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: Richmond 82, St. Bonaventure 65
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. -- Justin Harper scored 24 points and Richmond defeated St. Bonaventure 82-65 on Sunday. Justin Harper, one of four Spiders in double figures, also had four blocked shots Dan Geriot added 17 points, Darien Brothers had 16 points off the bench and Kevin Anderson chipped in 12 points for Richmond (21-7, 10-3 Atlantic 10 Conference). The Spiders, who lead the conference in shooting at 47.4 percent, made 50.8 percent of their field goals (31 of 61) against the Bonnies (14-11, 6-6). Kevin Smith chipped in seven assists and four steals for Richmond, which finished with 19 assists while turning it over eight times. The Spiders also shot 43.5 percent from 3-point range (10 of 23) and held St. Bonaventure to 4-of-15 shooting from beyond the arc. Demetrius Conger scored 17 and Andrew Nicholson had 14 of his 16 points in the second half for the Bonnies.
